technical-data.invention-title: Aufnahmeteil für die Aufnahme einer Stange zur Kopplung der Stange in einem Knochenverankerungselement und eine Knochenverankerungsvorrichtung mit einem derartigen Aufnahmeteil
Receiving part for receiving a rod for coupling the rod to a bone anchoring element and a bone anchoring device with such a receiving part
Pièce de réception pour recevoir une tige pour coupler la tige sur un élément d'ancrage d'os et dispositif d'ancrage d'os avec une telle pièce de réception

addressbook.last-name: Prüfer & Partner GbR European Patent Attorneys

description.p: The invention relates to a receiving part for receiving a rod for coupling the rod to a bone anchoring element and a bone anchoring device with such a receiving part. The receiving part includes a receiving part body and a pressure element located at least partly in an accommodation space of the receiving part body. The pressure element has a flexible portion to clamp the head. The pressure element can assume in the receiving part body an insertion position in which introduction and removal of the head is permitted, a locking position in which the head is locked in the receiving part and a pre-locking position in which the head is clamped by the pre-stress exerted by the pressure element.
Various designs of polyaxial bone screws, wherein the head is clamped from the side to lock the rotational position of the bone screw, are known.

US 5,672,176 describes a bone screw with a receiving part with a conically shaped seat and a conically shaped pressure element which exerts a pressure onto the head from above and from the side. If the cone angle has a value laying within a specific range self-locking of the pressure element within the receiving part takes place which allows to preliminary lock the head within a receiving part while the rod is still movable in order to allow the adjustment of its position.

WO 2007/038350 A2 discloses an apparatus for connecting a bone anchor to a support rod, the apparatus including a connector body and a cap. The connector body has a socket for insertion, angulation and removal of a bone anchor. A sleeve is provided which is configured to fit over the connector body in a temporary position, in which the sleeve permits insertion of the bone anchor, to move to a provisional locking position, in which the sleeve permits angulation but prevents removal of the bone anchor, and to move to a locking position, in which the sleeve prevents both angulation and removal of the bone anchor.

US 6,063,090 relates to a device used to connect a longitudinal support to a pedicle screw by an accommodating head having a channel to accommodate the longitudinal support. The pedicle screw and the accommodating head are connected via a conical collet chuck in the accommodating head and by a spherical head on the pedicle screw. The device allows engagement of the pedicle screw in the accommodating head after the pedicle screw has been inserted into the bone.

US 6,132,432 describes a spinal implant fixation assembly including a bone fixation member such as a screw and a rod receiving seat which is operatively connected to the bone fixation element. In one embodiment a screw head receiving insert is provided, which is movable within the assembly between a locked position entrapping the screw head therein and an unlocked position, wherein the screw head enters or escapes.

EP 0 947 174 A discloses a spinal fixation assembly comprising rod receiving means for receiving a portion of a rod therein and including compressible insert means for seating the portion of the rod therein in a non-compressed condition and conforming around the portion of the rod to fixedly lock the portion of the rod therein in a compressed condition.

US 2005/137594 A1 discloses a method for clamping a component of a spinal stabilization construct comprising, wherein a linear force is applied to the construct, is converted to a radial force which is converted back to a linear force which causes the component of the spinal stabilization construct to be clamped in position.

US 2008/243193 A1 discloses a pedicle screw assembly comprising a screw having a threaded portion and a head portion and a tulip body configured to be positioned on said head portion of said screw. At least one wedge member is configured to be inserted between a tulip saddle and the said tulip body.

US 2008/0183215 A1 discloses a spinal alignment system for interconnecting vertebral bodies, comprising a bone fastener, a seat connected to the bone fastener, wherein said seat having a first rod receiving portion, a second rod receiving portion, a first rod channel and a second rod channel. The seat is configured to connect a first rod at the first rod receiving portion and a second rod at the second rod receiving portion such that at least on of the first and second rods is polyaxially movable with respect to the seat while in a position projecting through a respective rod channel.

It is the object of the invention to provide an improved receiving part for receiving a rod for coupling the rod to a bone anchoring element and a bone anchoring device with such a receiving part, which consists of few parts and has an improved handling during surgery.
The object is solved by a receiving part according to claim 1 and a bone anchoring device according to claim 15. Further developments are given in the dependent claims.

The pressure element can be arranged in the receiving part body in three positions. In the insertion position the head is insertable from the bottom into the accommodation space of the receiving part body. In the pre-locljng position the pressure element pre-locks the head in the accommodation space, which prevents inadvertent removal of the head from the receiving part body and prevents inadvertent movement of the head with respect to the receiving part body during surgery. This allows a safe handling of the bone anchoring device during surgery. In the locking position the head is finally locked in the receiving part. The pressure element can be releasably held in the insertion position and the pre-locking position. This makes the handling convenient.

Pre-locljng and final locking of the head are achieved with the same pressure element. Hence, the receiving part and the bone anchoring device according to the invention comprise few elements which reduces the costs for manufacturing and which facilitates handling. It makes use of the principle of clamping the head of the bone anchoring element circumferentially from the lateral side which reduces the force necessary to safely clamp the head. The design of the receiving part allows to introduce the head from the bottom of the receiving part, which has advantages if a modular system shall be provided wherein various bone anchors with different receiving parts shall be available prior to surgery.
Further features and advantages of the invention will become apparent from the description of embodiments using the accompanying drawings.

In the drawings: Fig. 1shows a perspective exploded view of a bone anchoring device.Fig. 2shows a perspective view of the bone anchoring device of Fig. 1 in an assembled state.Fig. 3shows a perspective view of the pressure element according to Fig. 1.Fig. 4shows a side view of the pressure element of Fig. 3.Fig. 5shows a side view of the pressure element shown in Fig. 4 rotated by 90°.Fig. 6shows a sectional view of the pressure element shown in Fig. 5.Fig. 7shows a bottom view of the pressure element shown in Figs. 3 to 6.Fig. 8shows a sectional view of the bone anchoring device in a first position of the pressure element, when the bone anchoring element is not yet inserted, wherein the section is taken perpendicular to the rod axis.Fig. 9shows a sectional view of the bone anchoring device according to Fig. 1 with the pressure element in the first position and the bone anchoring element partly inserted.Fig. 10shows the bone anchoring device of Fig. 9 with the bone anchoring element fully inserted.Fig. 11shows a sectional view of the bone anchoring device of Fig. 1 with the pressure element in a pre-locking position.Fig. 12shows an enlarged view of a detail of Fig. 11.Fig. 13aand 13b show two alternative examples for the design of the outer and inner cooperating surfaces of the pressure element and the receiving part body, respectively.Fig. 13cto 13h show further examples for the design of the outer and inner cooperating surfaces of the pressure element and the receiving part body, respectively.Fig. 14shows the bone anchoring device of Fig. 8 with the rod inserted and the head finally locked.Fig. 15shows an exploded perspective view of a bone anchoring device according to the invention.Fig. 16shows an enlarged side view of the pressure element of Fig. 15.Fig. 17shows a sectional view of the pressure element of Fig. 16.Fig. 18shows a side view of the pressure element of Fig. 16 rotated by 90°.Fig. 19shows a bottom view of the pressure element of Fig. 16.Fig. 20shows a sectional view of the bone anchoring device according to Fig. 15 with the pressure element in the insertion position and the bone anchoring element not yet inserted, wherein the section is taken perpendicular to the rod axis.Fig. 21shows the bone anchoring device of Fig. 20 with the bone anchoring element fully inserted.Fig. 22shows the bone anchoring device of Fig. 20 with the pressure element in a position just before achieving the pre-locking position.Fig. 23shows the bone anchoring device of Fig. 20 with the pressure element in the prelocking position.Fig. 24shows an enlarged view of a detail of Fig. 23.Fig. 25shows an enlarged view of a further detail of Fig. 23.Fig. 26shows the bone anchoring device of Fig. 20 with the pressure element in the locking position and the head finally locked.

As shown in Figures 1 and 2, a bone anchoring device comprises a bone anchoring element 1 in the form of a bone screw having a threaded shaft 2 and a head 3, which is a spherical segment-shaped head. The head 3 has a recess 4 for engagement with a screwing-in tool. The bone anchoring device further comprises a receiving part body 5 for receiving a rod 6 to connect the rod to the bone anchoring element 1. Further, a closure element 7 in the form of an inner screw is provided for securing the rod 6 in the receiving part body 5. In addition, the bone anchoring device includes a pressure element 8 for locking the head in the receiving part body 5. The pressure element 8 is held in the receiving part body 5, for example via pins 9a, 9b.

The receiving part body 5 is now explained with reference to Figures 1 and 8 to 14. The receiving part body 5 comprises a first end 10 and an opposite second end 11 and an axis of symmetry M passing through the first and the second end. A bore 12 is provided which is coaxial with the axis of symmetry M. In a first region adjacent to the first end 10 the receiving part body 5 has a U-shaped recess 13, which is symmetric with respect to the symmetry axis M, the recess 13 having a bottom directed towards the second end 11 and two free lateral legs 14a, 14b extending towards the first end 10. In the region of the legs 14a, 14b an internal thread 15, which cooperates with the inner screw 7, is provided. A channel formed by the U-shaped recess 13 is sized so as to receive the rod 6 therein which connects a plurality of anchoring devices. At a second region near the second end 11 the cylindrical portion of the bore 12 is followed by a first tapered portion 16 tapering towards the second end 11 with a cone angle. The first tapered portion 16 is followed by a second tapered portion 17 tapering towards the second end 11 with a cone angle, which is smaller than that of the first tapered portion. An opening 18 is provided at the second end 11. The diameter of the opening 18 is larger than the diameter of the head 3 and smaller than the inner diameter of the bore 12. The coaxial bore 12 provides an accommodation space for the screw head 3.
On each leg 14a, 14b, bores 20a, 20b extending through the legs 14a, 14b are provided for receiving the pins 9a, 9b. The bores are located approximately at the center of each leg.

As can be seen in Figures 1 and 3 to 7, the pressure element 8 essentially includes a first portion 81, which is substantially cylindrical and has an outer diameter which is slightly smaller than the inner diameter of the bore 12 so that the pressure element 8 is movable in the bore 12, and a second portion 82 which is recessed with respect to the first portion and which has a maximum outer diameter which is smaller than the inner diameter of the bore 12. The first portion 81 has at its end opposite to the second portion 82 a U-shaped recess 83 for receiving the rod 6 therein when the pressure element 8 is situated in the receiving part body 5. At the lateral sides of the U-shaped recess the pressure element comprises to elongate recesses 84 in the outer wall which are arranged opposite to each other and which are aligned such that their longer side is parallel to the axis of symmetry M of the receiving part body 5. As can be seen in Fig. 4, the width of the lateral sides of the first portion 81 decreases towards the free end.

The second portion 82 is formed similar to a collar and comprises a first end at the side of the first portion 81 which is recessed with respect to the first portion 81 and a second end and a hollow interior 85 which is substantially spherically shaped to clamp the spherical head 3 therein. The second end of the second portion 82 provides an opening 86 for introduction of the head 3. The outer wall of the second portion 82 comprises a first portion 87 which is spherical and adjacent to the opening 86 a second portion 88 which is tapered. The tapered portion 88 cooperates with the second tapered portion 17 of the receiving part body. The second portion 82 of the pressure element further comprises a plurality of slits 89 extending from the edge of the opening 86 through the second portion 82. The number and dimension of the slits 89 is such that the wall of the second portion is flexible enough to snap onto the head 3 when the head 3 is being inserted. Further, the pressure element comprises a coaxial bore 90 for providing access to the screw head by a tool.

As can be seen in Figures 8 to 14, since the pressure element has a maximum outer diameter which is slightly smaller than the inner diameter of the bore 12, it can be inserted from the first end 10 into the receiving part body 5. Once it is inserted, the pins 9a, 9b are introduced in the bores 20a, 20b so that they engage in the elongate recesses 84 thereby holding the pressure element with its U-shaped recess 83 aligned with the U-shaped recess 13 of the receiving part body and preventing escaping of the pressure element through the first end. Since the second portion 82 of the pressure element has an outer diameter which is smaller than the inner diameter of the bore 12, and since the second portion 82 of the pressure element has a flexible outer wall, the second portion can expand within the accommodation space 19 when the screw head is introduced.

All parts described before are made of a bio-compatible material, such as a bio-compatible metal like stainless steel or titanium or a bio-compatible metal alloy such as, for example, nitinol or are made from a bio-compatible plastic material, such as, for example, PEEK.

The steps of assembling the bone anchoring device are now explained with respect to Figures 8 to 14. First, when the pressure element 8 is introduced into the receiving part body and held by the pins 9a, 9b, it is oriented such that the opening 86 is directed to the second end 11 of the receiving part body. As shown in Fig. 8, the pressure element 8 is in its uppermost position which is the insertion position allowing the screw head 3 to be inserted. In the insertion position the flexible second portion of the pressure element is positioned freely in the accommodation space 19. The insertion position is limited against upward movement by an abutment which is provided by the engagement of the pins with the lower end of the recesses 84. As shown in Fig. 9, the screw head 3 is then inserted through the opening 18 into the accommodation space 19, where the second portion 82 of the pressure element 8 is located. The screw head 3 is introduced into the hollow interior 85 of the second portion 82 of the pressure element through the opening 86. Due to the flexible wall provided by the slits 89, the second portion expands into the accommodation space 19 as shown in Fig. 9. The second portion snaps onto the screw head 3 until it encompasses the screw head 3 as shown in Fig. 10. The pins also prevent the pressure element 8 from escaping through the open second end 10 when the screw head is inserted. In the insertion position the screw head 3 is pivotable in the receiving part and also removable if the pressure element remains in this position. There may be means (not shown) for holding the pressure element temporarily in the insertion position. Alternatively, the pressure element can be held in the insertion position by means of a tool (not shown).

Figures 11 to 12 show the pre-locking position of the pressure element. When the screw head 3 is inserted and the pressure element is pressed down slightly, the outer wall of the second portion 82 of the pressure element is guided by the first tapered portion 16, so that it contacts the second tapered portion 17 of the receiving part body. The tapered portion 88 of the outer wall of the pressure element and the tapered portion 17 come into engagement whereby a pre-stress is exerted by the second portion 82 of the pressure element onto the screw head 3 which pre-locks the head 3. Pre-locking means that under conditions arising during surgery, the angular position of the bone anchoring element 1 with respect to the receiving part body 5 is maintained and can be loosened only by exerting an additional force onto the receiving part body or the screw element. The pre-locking position of the pressure element can be achieved either manually by pushing down the pressure element or by inserting the rod and screwing-in the inner screw 7 so that the rod presses onto the pressure element thereby moving it slightly downwards.

Fig. 13a and 13b show the engagement of the outer surface portion of the pressure element and the inner surface portion of the receiving part body in the pre-locking condition. As described before, the surfaces 17, 88 can be tapered as shown in Fig. 13a. Alternatively, the surfaces 88', 17' can be rounded as shown in Fig. 13b. The first tapered portion 16 at the receiving part body 5 serves only for guidance and can be omitted.

In Fig. 13 the two tapered portions 17, 88 are tapered at substantially the same angle. This provides a substantially even pressure distribution (shown by arrows) between the second portion 88 of the pressure element and the tapered portion 17 of the receiving part body. Figure 13d and 13e show two different designs where the portions are tapered at different angles. Fig. 13d) shows a main contact area at the bottom and figure 13e shows a main contact area at the top of portion 17"'. Fig. 13f shows a tapered portion 88"" of the pressure element and a rounded portion 17"" of the receiving part body wherein the curvature is directed towards the center of the receiving part body. With such a configuration a positioned contact area at the rounded portion can be achieved.

In figures 13g and 13h the narrowing portion 170 of a modified example of the receiving part body 5 has a double spherical radius formed by two curved portions 170, 170b on top of each other with a groove 170c there between. The curvature is directed to the central axis M. Correspondingly, the modified pressure element 180 has at its lower end two inversely curved portions 180a, 180b which correspond to the curved portions 179a, 170b with a crest 180c there between and an outer crest 180d at an outer yielding edge of the pressure element.

As shown in figure 13e, when the pressure element 180 moves downwards, its lowermost edge engages in the groove 170c. In this position, there is a frictional clamping of the head 3, which still allows the head 3 to be pivoted upon exertion of a force, which is greater than the force to pivot the head 3 when the head 3 is introduced in the insertion position. This is a pre-locking condition. As shown in figure 9h, by further pressing downward the pressure element 180, the curvatures of the pressure element 180 engage with the curvatures of the narrowing portion 170 to finally lock the head 3.

A third position, which is the locking position, is shown in Fig. 14. The locking position is defined as the position of the pressure element in which the screw head 3 is finally locked within the receiving part body. In this position the tapered outer surface portion 88 of the pressure element engages the second tapered portion 17 of the receiving part body over a larger area. Thereby, the flexible wall of the second portion of the pressure element is pressed onto the head 3 so that the head 3 is locked. This position is achieved by finally tightening the inner screw 7 thereby pressing down the rod 6.

In use, the bone anchoring device can be, for example, pre-assembled in such a way that the suitable bone anchoring element 1 is selected and introduced into the receiving part body with inserted pressure element. It can be brought into the pre-locking condition by slightly pushing down the pressure element. Then, the screw element is screwed into the bone. The recess 4 of the head 3 can be accessed with the screw tool through the coaxial bore 12 and the bore 90. To correctly align the receiving part with respect to the rod to which it shall be connected, an additional force is exerted onto the receiving part either manually or by application of an instrument. Once the correct position of the rod with respect to other bone anchoring devices is achieved, the inner screw 7 is tightened thereby shifting down the pressure element into the locking position. A final tightening of the inner screw locks the rod and the head simultaneously.

The bone anchoring device can be pre-assembled either by the manufacture or in the course or preparation of the surgery or at any other time. Advantageously, the surgeon selects prior to surgery the necessary receiving parts in bone anchoring elements according to specific requirements of the clinical application. The design of the bone anchoring device allows to select the appropriate bone anchoring element in terms of diameter, length and other features of the anchoring section. Hence, a modular system is provided which includes receiving parts and several bone anchoring elements, which then individually can be chosen and adapted.

A bone anchoring device according to the invention is now described with respect to Figures 15 to 26. Parts, which are identical to those of Figures 1 to 14 have the same reference numerals and the description thereof will not be repeated. The bone anchoring device according to Figures 15 to 26 differs from the bone anchoring device of Figures 1 to 14 in the design of the pressure element and the pins. The pressure element 8' differs from the pressure element 8 in the first portion. The first portion 81' of the pressure element 8' has a shallow recess 83' which is substantially cylinder segment-shaped for guiding the rod 6. It further includes two upstanding resilient fingers 91 a, 91 b extending on both lateral sides of the recess 83' in the direction of the first end 10 of the receiving part body. The upstanding fingers have outwardly directed portions 92 at their free ends, respectively. The outer diameter of the first portion 83' at least in the region of the fingers is smaller than the inner diameter of the bore such that the resilient fingers can move.

The pins 9a', 9b' each have a flattened portion 93 the width of which is substantially the same as the width of the outwardly extending portion 92 of the resilient fingers. When the pins are inserted into the bores 20a, 20b, the portions 93 extend into the coaxial bore 12 of the receiving part body 5 as shown in Fig. 20. By means of this construction, an abutment is provided for the receiving part 8'.

The assembly of the bone anchoring device according to the invention is explained with respect to Figures 20 to 25. In Fig. 20, first, the pressure element 8' is inserted from the first end 10 into the receiving part body 5. Then the pins 9a', 9b' are inserted into the holes in the legs. The pressure element 8' is in such a position that the outwardly extending portions 92 of the resilient fingers are located above the flattened portions 93 of the pins. In this position the pressure element 8' is in the insertion position. Then, the screw head is inserted through the openings 18 and 86 until the second portion 82 of the pressure element 8' encompasses the screw head 3. Then, as shown in Fig. 22, the pressure element 8' is moved slightly downward to enter the pre-locking position. Thereby, the resilient fingers 91a, 91b are pressed inwards by the outwardly extending portion 92 moving around the flattened portion 93 of the pins. As shown in Fig. 23, the outwardly extending portions 92 move outward and the flattened portions 93 form an abutment for the pressure element. In this pre-locking position, the tapered outer surface portion of the second portion 82 engages the tapered portion 17 of the receiving part body. Since the pins act as a stop, the pre-locking position is secured.
Inserting the rod and screwing-in the inner screw 7 further moves down the pressure element until it achieves the final locking position as shown in Fig. 26.
The clinical use of the bone anchoring device is similar to that of the bone anchoring device of Figures 1 to 14.

Further modifications are possible. For example, the head of the bone anchoring element can have any other shape, such as, for example, a cylindrical shape whereby a monoaxial bone screw is provided allowing rotation of the screw element with respect to the receiving part around a single axis. The head 3 can also be conically shaped and the hollow interior portion 85 of the pressure element is adapted to this shape. In a further modification, the receiving part body 5 or at least the second portion 82 of the pressure element are made of a bio-compatible plastic material which provides elasticity to a certain degree. In this case, the slits may be omitted.

Alternatively to the bone anchoring device of Figures 15 to 26 a spring portion can be provided at the receiving part body which cooperates with a portion of the pressure element. Generally, the pins are only one example of achieving an abutment for the pressure element. Other constructions such as snap rings or others are also conceivable.

The receiving part body can have an inclined open end to allow a greater angulation of the head in one direction. The outer surface portion of the second portion 82 of the pressure element can be tapered and the second portion 17 of the receiving part body can be inwardly curved.

claim.claim-text:
Aufnahmeteil zum Aufnehmen eines Stabes zum Koppeln des Stabes an ein Knochenverankerungselement, wobei das Aufnahmeteil umfasst
einen Aufnahmeteilskörper (5) mit
einem Kanal (13) zum Aufnehmen des Stabes (6), und
einen Aufnahmeraum (19) zum Aufnehmen des Kopfes (3) des Knochenverankerungselements (1), wobei der Aufnahmeraum (19) eine Öffnung (18) zum Einführen des Kopfes aufweist; und
ein Druckelement (8'), welches zumindest teilweise in dem Aufnahmeraum (19) angeordnet ist, wobei das Druckelement einen flexiblen Abschnitt (83') aufweist, um den Kopf zu klemmen;
wobei das Druckelement (8') in dem Aufnahmeteilskörper (5) eine Einführposition einnehmen kann, in welcher eine Einführung des Kopfes erlaubt ist, eine Verriegelungsposition, in welcher der Kopf in dem Aufnahmeteil verriegelt ist und eine Vorverriegelungsposition, in welcher der Kopf geklemmt ist durch die Vorspannung, welche durch das Druckelement ausgeübt wird, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass das Druckelement (8') in der Vorverriegelungsposition gehalten wird durch eine Federkraft, und wobei die Federkraft generiert wird durch einen Federabschnitt (91a, 91b, 92) an dem Druckelement oder an dem Aufnahmeteilskörper, welcher jeweils mit einem Widerlager (93) an dem Aufnahmeteilskörper (5) oder dem Druckelement zusammenwirkt, wobei das Widerlager als Anschlag agiert, um die Vorverriegelungsposition zu sichern.
Aufnahmeteil nach Anspruch 1, wobei das Druckelement (8') in der Einführposition in dem Aufnahmeraum (19) expandierbar ist.
Aufnahmeteil nach Anspruch 1 oder 2, wobei die Einführposition durch einen Anschlag (9a,9b,84) limitiert ist, welcher auf das Druckelement (8') wirkt.

Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 3, wobei in der Vorverriegelungsposition die Vorspannung, welche auf den Kopf ausgeübt wird, generiert wird durch Klemmen eines Abschnitts (88) der Außenwand des Druckelements durch lediglich einen Abschnitt der Innenwand des Aufnahmeteilkörpers.
Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 4, wobei der Kopf in der Einführposition von dem Aufnahmeteilkörper entfernbar ist.

Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 5, wobei der Aufnahmeraum (19) im Wesentlichen zylindrisch ist mit einem sich verengenden Abschnitt (17) nahe der Öffnung, wobei der sich verengende Abschnitt vorzugsweise konisch oder gerundet ist.

Aufnahmeteil nach Anspruch 6, wobei das Druckelement einen sich verengenden Abschnitt (88) an seiner Außenwand umfasst, welcher vorzugsweise konisch oder gerundet ist und welcher mit dem sich verengenden Abschnitt (17) in dem Aufnahmeraum (19) zusammenwirkt.

Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 8, wobei der flexible Abschnitt (83) des Druckelements einen hohlen Abschnitt (85) aufweist zum Aufnehmen des Kopfes (3) und eine Öffnung (86) zum Einführen des Kopfes.
Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 8, wobei ein Außendurchmesser des flexiblen Abschnitts (82) kleiner ist als ein Innendurchmesser des Aufnahmeraums (19).
Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 9, wobei der Aufnahmeteilskörper (5) einen Abschnitt mit einer U-förmigen Ausnehmung (13) zum Aufnehmen des Stabes (6) umfasst.
Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 10, wobei das Druckelement (8,8') eine Ausnehmung (83') zum Aufnehmen des Stabes umfasst.
Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 11, wobei das Druckelement in dem Aufnahmeteilskörper gegen Austreten gesichert ist.

Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 12, wobei das Druckelement einen ersten Abschnitt umfasst, welcher eine Ausnehmung zum Aufnehmen des Stabes aufweist und einen zweiten Abschnitt, welcher den flexiblen Abschnitt (83') zum Klemmen des Kopfes aufweist und wobei ein Ende des zweiten Abschnitts, welcher an den ersten Abschnitt angrenzt, einen Außendurchmesser aufweist, welcher relativ zu einem Außendurchmesser des ersten Abschnitts zurückgesetzt ist.

Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 13, wobei der sich verengende Abschnitt des Aufnahmeteilkörpers zwei nebeneinanderliegende gekrümmte Abschnitte umfasst, welche konvexe Krümmungen aufweisen, welche gegen eine Zentralachse des Aufnahmeteils gerichtet sind und dazwischen eine Nut bilden, und wobei der sich verengende Abschnitt des Druckelements zwei nebeneinanderliegende gekrümmte Abschnitte umfasst, welche konkave Krümmungen aufweisen, welche jeweils den konvexen Krümmungen der zwei gekrümmten Abschnitte des Aufnahmeteilkörpers entsprechen, und einen dazwischen Kamm bilden, und wobei vorzugsweise in der Vorverriegelungsposition ein Rand des Druckelements in die Nut des Aufnahmeteilkörpers eingreift, und wobei in der Verriegelungsposition der Kamm des Druckelements in die Nut des Aufnahmeteilkörpers eingreift.

Knochenverankerungsvorrichtung umfassend ein Aufnahmeteil nach einem der Ansprüche 1-14 und ein Knochenverankerungselement aufweisend einen Schaft und einen Kopf und wobei vorzugsweise ein Schließelement vorgesehen ist zum Sichern des Stabes in dem Aufnahmeteil.

A receiving part for receiving a rod for coupling the rod to a bone anchoring element, the receiving part including
a receiving part body (5) with
a channel (13) for receiving the rod (6), and
an accommodation space (19) for accommodating a head (3) of the bone anchoring element (1), the accommodation space (19) having an opening (18) for introduction of the head; and
a pressure element (8') located at least partly in the accommodation space (19), the pressure element having a flexible portion (83') to clamp the head;
wherein the pressure element (8') can assume in the receiving part body (5) an inserting position in which introduction of the head is permitted, a locking position in which the head is locked in the receiving part and a pre-locking position in which the head is clamped by the pre-stress exerted by the pressure element,
characterized in that the pressure element (8') is held in the pre-locking position by a spring force and wherein the spring_force is generated by a spring portion (91a, 91b, 92) on the pressure element or on the receiving part body which cooperates with an abutment (93) on the receiving part body (5) or the pressure element, respectively, wherein the abutment acts as a stop to secure the pre-locking position.
The receiving part of claim 1, wherein in the inserting position the pressure element (8') is expandable in the accommodation space (19).
The receiving part of claim 1 or 2, wherein the inserting position is limited by a stop (9a,9b,84) acting onto the pressure element (8').

The receiving part of one of claims 1 to 3, wherein in the pre-locking position the prestress exerted onto the head is generated by clamping a portion (88) of the outer wall of the pressure element by only a portion of the inner wall of the receiving part body.
The receiving part of one of claims 1, to 4, wherein in the insertion position the head is removable from the receiving part body.

The receiving part of one of claims 1 to 5, wherein the accommodation space (19) is substantially cylindrical with a narrowing portion (17) near the opening, the narrowing portion being preferably tapered or rounded.

The receiving part of claim 6, wherein the pressure element comprises a narrowing portion (88) at its outer wall which is preferably tapered or rounded and which cooperates with the narrowing portion (17) in the accommodation space (19).

The receiving part of one of claims 1 to 8, wherein the flexible portion (83) of the pressure element has a hollow section (85) for accommodating the head (3) and an opening (86) for inserting the head.
The receiving part of one of claims 1 to 8, wherein an outer diameter of the flexible portion (82) is smaller that an inner diameter of the accommodation space (19).
The receiving part of one of claims 1 to 9, wherein the receiving part body (5) comprises a section with a U-shaped recess (13) for receiving the rod (6).
The receiving part of one of claims 1 to 10, wherein the pressure element (8,8') comprises a recess (83') for receiving the rod.
The receiving part of one of claims 1 to 11, wherein the pressure element is secured in the receiving part body against escaping.

A receiving part according to one of claims 1 to 12, wherein the pressure element comprises a first portion having a recess to receive the rod and a second portion having the flexible portion (83') to clamp the head and wherein an end of the second portion adjacent to the first portion has an outer diameter that is recessed with respect to an outer diameter of the first portion.

The receiving part of one of claims 1 to 13, wherein the narrowing portion of the receiving part body comprises two adjacent curved portions having convex curvatures directed towards a central axis of the receiving part and forming a groove therebetween, and wherein the narrowing portion of the pressure element comprises two adjacent curved portions having concave curvatures corresponding to the convex curvatures of the two curved portions of the receiving part body, respectively, and forming a crest therebetween, and wherein preferably in the pre-locking position an edge of the pressure element engages the groove of the receiving part body, and wherein in the locking position the crest of the pressure element engages the groove of the receiving part body.

A bone anchoring device comprising a receiving part according to one of claims 1 to 14 and a bone anchoring element having a shaft and a head and wherein preferably a closure element is provided for securing the rod in the receiving part.

Partie de réception destinée à recevoir une tige pour coupler la tige à un élément d'ancrage osseux, la partie de réception comportant
un corps (5) de la partie de réception avec un canal (13) destiné à recevoir la tige (6), et
un espace de logement (19) destiné à loger une tête (3) de l'élément d'ancrage osseux (1), l'espace de logement (19) ayant une ouverture (18) pour l'introduction de la tête ; et
un élément de pression (8') situé au moins partiellement dans l'espace de logement (19), l'élément de pression ayant une partie flexible (83') pour serrer la tête ;
où l'élément de pression (8') peut prendre, dans le corps (5) de la partie de réception, une position d'insertion dans laquelle l'introduction de la tête est autorisée, une position de verrouillage dans laquelle la tête est verrouillée dans la partie de réception et une position de pré-verrouillage dans laquelle la tête est serrée par la précontrainte exercée par l'élément de pression,
caractérisée en ce que l'élément de pression (8') est maintenu dans la position de pré-verrouillage par une force élastique, et où la force élastique est générée par une partie élastique (91a, 91b, 92) sur l'élément de pression ou sur le corps de la partie de réception qui coopère avec une butée (93) sur le corps (5) de la partie de réception ou l'élément de pression, respectivement, où la butée agit comme une cale pour fixer la position de pré-verrouillage.
Partie de réception de la revendication 1, dans laquelle, dans la position d'insertion, l'élément de pression (8') est extensible dans l'espace de logement (19).
Partie de réception de la revendication 1 ou 2, dans laquelle la position d'insertion est limitée par une cale (9a, 9b, 84) agissant sur l'élément de pression (8').

Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 3, dans laquelle, dans la position de pré-verrouillage, la précontrainte exercée sur la tête est générée par le serrage d'une partie (88) de la paroi extérieure de l'élément de pression par uniquement une partie de la paroi intérieure du corps de la partie de réception.
Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 4, dans laquelle, dans la position d'insertion, la tête peut être retirée du corps de la partie de réception.

Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 5, dans laquelle l'espace de logement (19) est essentiellement cylindrique avec une partie de rétrécissement (17) à proximité de l'ouverture, la partie de rétrécissement étant de préférence conique ou arrondie.

Partie de réception de la revendication 6, dans laquelle l'élément de pression comprend une partie de rétrécissement (88) au niveau de sa paroi extérieure qui est de préférence conique ou arrondie et qui coopère avec la partie de rétrécissement (17) dans l'espace de logement (19).

Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 8, dans laquelle la partie flexible (83) de l'élément de pression présente une section creuse (85) pour loger la tête (3) et une ouverture (86) pour insérer la tête.
Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 8, dans laquelle un diamètre extérieur de la partie flexible (82) est inférieur au diamètre intérieur de l'espace de logement (19).
Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 9, dans laquelle le corps (5) de la partie de réception comprend une section avec un évidement en forme de U (13) pour recevoir la tige (6).
Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 10, dans laquelle l'élément de pression (8, 8') comprend un évidement (83') pour recevoir la tige.
Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 11, dans laquelle l'élément de pression est fixé dans le corps de la partie de réception pour empêcher son glissement.

Partie de réception selon l'une des revendications 1 à 12, dans laquelle l'élément de pression comprend une première partie ayant un évidement pour recevoir la tige et une deuxième partie ayant la partie flexible (83') pour serrer la tête, et où une extrémité de la deuxième partie adjacente à la première partie présente un diamètre extérieur qui est en retrait par rapport à un diamètre extérieur de la première partie.

Partie de réception de l'une des revendications 1 à 13, dans laquelle la partie de rétrécissement du corps de la partie de réception comprend deux parties incurvées adjacentes ayant des courbures convexes dirigées vers un axe central de la partie de réception et formant une rainure entre celles-ci, et où la partie de rétrécissement de l'élément de pression comprend deux parties incurvées adjacentes ayant des courbures concaves correspondant aux courbures convexes des deux parties incurvées du corps de la partie de réception, respectivement, et formant une crête entre celles-ci, et où, de préférence, dans la position de pré-verrouillage, un bord de l'élément de pression vient en prise avec la rainure du corps de la partie de réception, et où, dans la position de verrouillage, la crête de l'élément de pression vient en prise avec la rainure du corps de la partie de réception.

Dispositif d'ancrage osseux comprenant une partie de réception selon l'une des revendications 1 à 14 et un élément d'ancrage osseux ayant un arbre et une tête, et dans lequel, de préférence, un élément de fermeture est prévu pour fixer la tige dans la partie de réception.
